page.title: 16Home Life
page.content: Life at Pickaxe Lane: The Lane has 14 houses mostly with very large gardens. People grow a lot of their own veget- ables. The people who live there keep themselves very much to themselves. 6 houses are privately owned and the rest are farmworkers homes. All have a colour television set, some have video recorders, every house has a washing machine, every home has at least 2 cars. There are 3 swimming pools and 2 tennis courts. A school bus collects 4 children and takes them to the state school. Every home has at least one of the following: rabbits, dogs,cats, horses, hampster, goldfish. Some have tortoises which after 1986 it will be illegal to import into this country so will become very expensive. Cooking is by Calor gas, electricity or solid fuel, that is wood or coal as there is no gas piped to the area.
